description:
Code *coverage* shows what lines or branches your tests are missing. If
you maintain Python code, chances are you use ``coverage.py`` to measure
it. You probably don't use it all the time, though, as it slows down
your tests -- up to a whopping 2.6x. This talk introduces SlipCover, a
new tool that brings this overhead down to only 5%. We look into what
slows down ``coverage.py``, and show how ``SlipCover`` is able to do
better. For Python 3.12, SlipCover adopts the new `Low Impact Monitoring
API <https://peps.python.org/pep-0669/>`__ (PEP669); we discuss the
advantages and challenges of integrating it into SlipCover.
title: Near Zero-Overhead Python Code Coverage
